TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Everything's Shaping Up" Edition

Articles.Content:
I have another question for the FAQ: will we be able to "sell" landed asteroids by reclaiming them?

Lol, that would actually be an interesting thing to find out!

I read about new engines that is great I can't wait for update

I would also love to see:

- spherical fuel tanks for both LF and RCS,

- larger Rockomax Brand Adapter 02 for diameters 3.75m to 2.5m,

- longer m-beams and girders,

- structural panels 2x1, 3x1, 2x4, 4x4,

- TVR-200 Stack Bi-Coupler from 3.75 to 2.5,

- larger The Not-Rockomax Micronode,

- Advanced S.A.S Module, Large for 3.75m

- RC-L01 Remote Guidance Unit for 3.75m

For the FAQ: What would happen if you ran out of money in career mode? Do you get a game over screen or something?

I'm eager to know this also. Can't wait for .24.
there working on the mk series parts? does this mean we will get a Mk3 Liquid fuel and Oxidizer and maybe a Mk3 to 2.5m converter part

We have removed from this thread an off-topic discussion of Kerbal EDU. Some of the posts were insulting, some were merely misleading, and some were unobjectionable but were replying to insulting/off-topic posts. Kerbal EDU will be not so much a game as a piece of educational software based upon the game, and it has nothing to do with 0.24. Please keep the discussion on-topic.

next step - Interactive IVA's!!!!!

IVA's are interactive already?

IVA's are interactive already?

I was meaning more the enhanced IVA - interacting and moving inside the vehicle.
For the FAQ, Will the game track rep Kerbals gained? As in, Jeb has a rep of over 9000 Bill has a rep of 3 and Bob is awaiting his first launch.

For the game FAQ after watching preview videos:

How will reverting the game back to launch/VAB/F9, etc work with the contract system? If I set the 5000m world record, and then my 101st (we told Jeb 100 was enough) solid-booster overheats and goes BOOM causing me to roll-back to save Jeb;, I assume that the rep, money, and contract completion would all roll back as well -- or perhaps once it's completed it's completed? I assume this would work with multiple ships in play and etc. as well. Or perhaps reverting back will cause the contract to act as though it was a failure?

I assume that the rep, money, and contract completion would all roll back as well

This. A reload is a reload - there's no reason to assume that rep, funds and contract completion would behave any differently than Science (or progress in general) does now. If you reload, you lose all progress done since the last save, simple as that.

This. A reload is a reload - there's no reason to assume that rep, funds and contract completion would behave any differently than Science (or progress in general) does now. If you reload, you lose all progress done since the last save, simple as that.

I only asked, because at times with .23.5 when you transmit science data back to KSP from space (non-return), then you revert back one way or another, that science-transmission isn't repeatable (already done) and is obtained by KSP even post-rollback. Wondered if some contracts may work on the same system.

Yes, I would also be on the assumption of "a rollback is a rollback" just like you in my own opinions as well.

For the game FAQ after watching preview videos:

How will reverting the game back to launch/VAB/F9, etc work with the contract system? If I set the 5000m world record, and then my 101st (we told Jeb 100 was enough) solid-booster overheats and goes BOOM causing me to roll-back to save Jeb;, I assume that the rep, money, and contract completion would all roll back as well -- or perhaps once it's completed it's completed? I assume this would work with multiple ships in play and etc. as well. Or perhaps reverting back will cause the contract to act as though it was a failure?

EDIT: Ninja'd

Reverting just loads a previous save. The entire persistence state is in that save, so it's likely it will revert it all. I would be utterly shocked to find it was different because that would mean they implemented this outside the bounds of the persistence files.

I only asked, because at times with .23.5 when you transmit science data back to KSP from space (non-return), then you revert back one way or another, that science-transmission isn't repeatable (already done) and is obtained by KSP even post-rollback. Wondered if some contracts may work on the same system.

Yes, I would also be on the assumption of "a rollback is a rollback" just like you in my own opinions as well.

It can be all too easy for variables to fail to be overwritten on a reload. If this happens on a Revert or Load then it is a bug and should be reported in the Support/Bug Report forum.
